alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 1:26AM CST until February 06 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Cumberland River At Clarksville affecting Montgomery County. For the Cumberland River...including Celina, Penitentiary Branch, Carthage, Hunters Point, Edenwold, Hermitage, Pennington Bend, Omohundro Water Plant, Nashville, Bordeaux, Briley Pkwy At Cockrill Bend, Ashland City, Clarksville, Dover...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River At Clarksville. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, Low lying areas along the river, including agricultural areas, access points, and portions of Riverfront Park on North Riverside Dr begin to be inundated. Water also backs up adjacent tributaries, including Bartons Creek, Red River, West Fork Red River, and Yellow Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 38.5 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 41.5 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood stage is 46.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM CST.
